greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product representation of the Pell numbers A000129 and A002203.
comment: Define the silver mean constants h=1+sqrt(2) = A014176, h^2=1+2h = A156035, and 1/h=h-2.
Let Phi(n,x) be the n-th cyclotomic polynomial A013595, so that x^n-1 = Product_{d | n} Phi(d, x). Let g(n) be the order of Phi(n, x), A000010. Then a(n)=(h-2)^g(n)*Phi(n, h^2) if n <> 2.
The Binet representations of the Pell numbers yields:
For even n, A000129(n) = Product_{d|n} a(d).
For odd n, A000129(n)=Product_{ d|n} a(2d).
For odd prime p, a(p)=A002203(p)/2, a(2p)=A000129(p).
For odd n, A002203(n)=Product_{ d|n} a(d).
For k>0 and odd n, A002203(n*2^k)=Product_{ d | n} a(d*2^(k+1)).
link: Dan Kalman and Robert Mena, The Fibonacci Numbers: Exposed, Math. Mag. 76 (3) (2003) 167-181.
Index to sequences related to cyclotomic polynomials.
maple: A072280 := proc(n) if n <= 2 then 3-n ; else g := numtheory[phi](n) ; h := 1+sqrt(2) ; (h-2)^g*numtheory[cyclotomic](n,h^2) ; simplify(expand(%)) ; end if; end proc:
results.author: _Miklos Kristof_, Jul 10 2002
ext: Edited and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 27 2009
